Package ca.caro.assetmanagement.database

Class AssetHandler

java.lang.Object
ca.caro.assetmanagement.database.AssetHandler
public class AssetHandler
extends java.lang.Object
Asset Handler Class

Class that handles interaction of the web application to the MS SQL Server. Contains methods for handling the Asset Related tables with operations such as adding, editing, and deleting asset as well as methods for getting asset info.

    • addAsset

      public boolean addAsset​(java.lang.String[] params)
      This method is used to attempt to add Asset into the database. Parameter String[] structure: [Asset ID], [Asset Description], [Serial #], [Asset Category], [Cost], [Brand ID], [Purchase Date]
      Parameters:
      params - String[] parameters for adding an asset.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if add operation is success, false adding is failed

    • addToArchive

      public boolean addToArchive​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> archiveParams)
      Process the input parameter and insert new entry to asset_sold_archive table by connection with database and performing SQL
      Parameters:
      archiveParams - the parameters required for INSERT TO asset_sold_archive table
      Returns:
      true if entry is successfully added, else return false

    • addAssigned_to

      public boolean addAssigned_to​(java.lang.String[] params)
      This method is used to attempt to assign to Assigned To. Parameter String[] structure: [Personnel ID], [Asset ID]
      Parameters:
      params - String[] parameters for adding an asset.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if add operation is success, false adding is failed

    • deleteAsset

      public boolean deleteAsset​(java.lang.String assetID)
      This method is used to attempt to delete an Asset.
      Parameters:
      assetID - String ID for asset that will be deleted.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if add operation is success, false adding is failed

    • deleteAssigned_to

      public boolean deleteAssigned_to​(java.lang.String assigned_to_personel_id, java.lang.String assigned_to_asset_id)
      DELETE the entry in assigned_to table base on parameters. It connects to database and performs SQL.
      Parameters:
      assigned_to_personel_id - the user id of the entry being deleted
      assigned_to_asset_id - the asset id of the entry being deleted
      Returns:
      true if deleted success, else false

    • editAsset

      public boolean editAsset​(java.lang.String[] params)
      This method is used to attempt to edit an Asset in the database. Parameter String[] structure: []; []
      Parameters:
      params - String[] parameters for editing an Asset.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if add operation is success, false adding is failed

    • editAssigned_to

      public boolean editAssigned_to​(java.lang.String NEW_assigned_to_personel_id, java.lang.String OLD_assigned_to_personel_id, java.lang.String assigned_to_asset_id)
      Edit the assigned__to table, change the user that is assigned to the given asset, by connecting with database and performing SQL
      Parameters:
      NEW_assigned_to_personel_id - the unique id of the new user that is assigned to the asset
      OLD_assigned_to_personel_id - the original id of the user that WAS assigned to the asset
      assigned_to_asset_id - the unique id of the asset
      Returns:
      true if the user assigned to the asset is edited, else return false

    • editDeprec_value

      public boolean editDeprec_value​(java.lang.String asset_id, java.lang.String deprec_info_id)
      Edit the depreciated value of the given asset and update the table, it is done by connecting the database and performing SQL
      Parameters:
      asset_id - the unique id of the asset
      deprec_info_id - the unique id of the applied depreciation formula
      Returns:
      true the depreciation value of the asset is edited, else return false
